title: Add Random Delays in between KeyDown Handle
body:
- Adding a simple random delays produced within a acceptable range seems to not trigger input automation detection systems (E.g CS2). This PR adds a randomly generated delay between key down handles which would look more natural 
- The Minimum and Maximum trigger delay in milliseconds can be configured through the `config.cfg` file by adding the line `random_delay_ms=(10,70)` where 10,70 ms is the random delay bounds.
- The above mentioned delay times seems to perform well and does not trigger the detection system. The more you reduce the delay more like you are to get detected. 10,70 ms felt like a sweet spot where 70ms still fast enough switching and won't get detected [until the another detection algorithm cracks this].
author: fazildgr8

comments.body:

title: Arrow keys as Numpad
body: I set up my arrow keys but if num lock is active it inputs num8, num4, num6 and num2 instead of the arrow keys
author: hdcrafterlp

comments.body: This behavior is normal since some of the numpad keys also include the arrow key functionality. When activating/deactivating numpad the keycodes of NUM2-4-6-8 change to the Arrow keycodes.

Due to these issues, I wonâ€™t be able to accept the PR, as it lacks the quality and review needed for integration. In the future, Iâ€™d recommend double-checking your content before submitting, especially in open-source repositories where accuracy is valued.

title: SnapKey interfering with Windows emoji keyboard
body: I'm not sure if other people use the Windows emoji keyboard, it's activated using Windows and period, it opens just fine, but when SnapKey is enabled, you're unable to use _SnapKeys_ in the emoji keyboard ðŸ’€.
author: eiqnepm

comments.body:
Thank you for bringing this up - however, SnapKey is specifically designed for use within games and not for general Windows navigation or applications like the windows emoji keyboard. 

The limitation you mentioned only affects the Arrow Keys, which are typically used for navigation in Windows apps.

An Option to disable SnapKey when not gaming has already been implemented in v.1.2.3/v.1.2.4 to avoid unwanted "Sticky Keys" conflicts with the OS while using it outside of games, so we recommend enabling it only while gaming and turning it off for other tasks outside of games or in situations where SnapKey is not needed.

Iâ€™ll be closing this issue as it falls outside the intended scope of the software.

> Iâ€™ll be closing this issue as it falls outside the intended scope of the software.

Would a toggle hotkey with a different on and off sound be in scope? Being able to enable and disable SnapKey rapidly and with an audible confirmation would definitely be much more convenient than using the tray menu

title: Using the Perfect World Platform to start cs2 wsad cannot be moved
author: rfvygv

comments.body:
This is a known problem with the CS2 Perfect World client, and unfortunately, it won't be fixed. This issue has also been mentioned previously. You can find more details here: Issue #42.

SnapKey works as intended with the global CS2 version - the problem may be caused by the client directly, not the input system of the game.

title: Occasional 'Stuck key' in CS2
body:
Occasionally, when using Snapkey in CS2, a key will 'stick' and stay depressed when it is physically not being pressed in that instance of time. 

Here's what I know. 
-From my experience, it appears that a key may stick when using the inputs (SHFT+A), and in one instance where it was (SHFT+A,S). Occurs when I walk backward in CS. 
-Unsticking the key is done by releasing all keys and selecting the opposite key, and snapkey is back to normal. 

I will attempt to replicate it and report back.

title: Key stays pressed.
body:
Hello, 
 I've been using your program for the last 2 days, and I've noticed that sometimes, one of the keys ( azerty ) stays pressed even when releasing the key, forcing me to re press the key to cancel the previous action. 
 
  Any idea on what might cause this issue ? My keyboard is a corsair K55 RGB PRO

comments.body: try this with the latest release (1.2.0), the updated input handler may prevent the issue
Thanks, I'll give it a try and let you know
I'm also having this issue while playing cs2... Same behavior, key gets "stuck"

Hello, I'm back, after testing the latest release, I'd say this happens even more than before, but now  I know how to replicate this : 

 I crouch using alt, and play on azerty. 
 
Whenever I crouch then move, my character just doesn't move. 

Whenever I move, crouch while moving then changing directions, the software keeps sticking to the first key I pressed til I repress it.
we've managed to confirm this issue in #52 with the ALT modifier; fix is in the works
I'm glad the issue is already confirmed and being worked on, I'll close this issue now, have a good day

title: Dont work in R6
body: Dont work right in Rainbow Six Siege. Can u make it work for R6?
author: VeryHotOrange

comments.body: CoD Mw3, XDefiant as well. I was able to get it work just in SP games so I believe they got covered such a "script" in any case thank you for your hard work presentation of SnapKey is brilliant keep up the good work mate.
Tried in Apex, CS 1.6 and it doesn't work. It shows it working in an online keyboard tester, just not in any games. Windows 10.

SnapKey adds global systemwide null binds and is not designed to engage with or manipulate any game files.

It is not designed to work with a "specific" game.

For it to work with R6 (or any other game where the input detection is designed this way), you would need to rewrite the code and interact directly with the game files or even the game engine.

There is no need to mention that this could get you banned, as you would be manipulating the game files.

title: Add CMake config files for easy compilation.
body: I was thinking some users (for ease of mind's sake) or even you @cafali would like a quick way to compile SnapKey so here is the config for CMake as well as a batch file `CMake-Build.bat` to make this process simple. If you want the executable to have the same icon as the one on release please just modify the `resources.rc` file and/or upload it to github.
author: Yaw-Dev

comments.body:
consider adding
```
set(BUILD_SHARED_LIBS OFF)
set(CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS "-static")
```
before `add_executable` to build static libraries, else the built exe will not run on systems without some gcc/clang specific libs

this cmake setup is very helpful o7

Sure thing. Iâ€™ll upload the SnapKey EXE icon later today and call it "snapkey.ico" since "icon.ico" is already used for the tray icon. 
Also, consider to include the details @minteeaa mentioned about the static libraries, and weâ€™ll be all set.
This `set(CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS "-static")` was giving me a `unrecognised option '/static'` warning so I searched around and found another way to do it (check lines 6..11).

also would you want something like this?
```bat
@echo off

mkdir build > nul
cd build > nul
echo Preparing files...
cmake .. > nul
echo Compiling...
cmake --build . > nul
cd .. > nul
move "build\Debug\SnapKey.exe" "." > nul
echo Done!
rmdir /s /q build > nul
pause > nul
```
to "beatify" the whole process.
Looks good, why not

title: Question: Input delay related to it being an app?
body: As far as I'm aware the Snap Tap feature Razer introduced runs on a hardware level and so doesn't affect input latency at all. SnapKey however is a usermode application so in my mind latency could be added. Is that true?
author: Yaw-Dev

comments.body:
I am not sure if  the new Razer feature is hardware-based, as it requires you to install external software to activate it. If it were functioning at the hardware level, a new key or shortcut could be introduced to trigger it directly from the keyboard.

The only distinction is that it is optimized for the new ultra-fast switches included in their latest keyboards, which helps reduce input latency. SnapKey, on the other hand, is designed to work with any keyboard, even the most basic $5 keyboards.

Regarding input latency, I personally havenâ€™t noticed any delay while using it, and I lack the means to conduct formal latency benchmarks.
After some testing I didn't observe anything noticable either. Thanks for this by the way, very cool project.

title: Feature Request: Changeable keybinds
body:
I have a problem where I have an EU keyboard, and I was wondering if I could somehow change keybinds?

Instead of the US version where they use A/D I would like to change keybinds to Q/D as example.
author: TheAmpPlayer

comments.body:
Ah I see, seems like there already was a request.

My apologies.

Key binding is now available!

1.1.3 - 07/2024 (latest)

Key Bindings:
Introducing customizable key bindings to accommodate various keyboard layouts such as AZERTY (where A=Q, D=D). You can now modify the keys managed by SnapKey by editing the config.cfg file using the ASCII Code List.

Others:
Updated Readme.pdf
